definition:
A Process involving actions in digital systems or networks, including
   access, modification, collection, disruption, or defense activities.

positive_examples: This is an example of cyber operation.
The cyber operation demonstrated clear characteristics.
We observed cyber operation in this context.
A typical case of cyber operation would involve these features.
The concept of cyber operation applies here.
Military information operations conducted through digital networks and computer systems to achieve military objectives.
negative_examples: This is an example of defensive information operation, not cyber operation.
This represents information operation in general.
The document was filed in the cabinet.
She walked to the store to buy groceries.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: DefensiveInformationOperation, or other types of InformationOperation

opposite_reasoning: PhysicalProcess provides the strongest and most meaningful opposition to CyberOperation. The digital/virtual ↔ physical/tangible dimension is fundamental and well-established in ontology. This opposition is valuable for AI safety monitoring because it helps distinguish between cyber threats (digital attacks, data manipulation) and physical threats (kinetic operations, material damage). The concept is well-supported in both WordNet and SUMO ontologies. For Fisher-LDA, this creates a clear axis: cyber/digital operations cluster at one end, physical/mechanical processes at the other, providing strong discriminative power for classifying operational domains.
